result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:57 AM; Case called for Hearing.   Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Adam J Wachendorf in court.  Attorney Paul E Bucher in court for Adam J Wachendorf.  Atty. Bucher provides an update; he believes parties are very close to resolving the matter but he needs some additional time.  Atty. Bucher is asking for a plea and sentencing date in November.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing in November.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Filed by Atty. Bucher requesting to have the 9/23/2022 Plea/sentencing hearing rescheduled. **Reviewed by Judge Reilly, for Branch 7, 9/14/22 - Matter can be re-set for hearing or leave on as scheduled and address scheduling at that time.**
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Filed by Atty. Bucher requesting to have the 8/22/2022 plea and sentencing rescheduled.  **Reviewed by Judge Reilly 8/11/22 - Request granted.**
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Filed by Atty Paul Bucher

Plea/sentencing hearing on August 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

10:48 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Adam J Wachendorf in court with attorney Paul E Bucher.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Nikole Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Bucher notes an Amended Information and the lab report has been filed.  Atty. Bucher acknowledges receipt, waives reading of Amended Information, and enters intial not guity plea.  Atty. Bucher provides an update, he needs time to review pre-trial offer with client and for his client to work on treatment.  Atty. Bucher requests a further proceedings or projected plea and sentencing date in about 30 days.  Court adjourns for projected plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Amended Information filed by the State.
Laboratory report filed by the State.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Hearing on July 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:17 AM Defendant Adam J Wachendorf appeared by Zoom with Attorney Thomas Simon for Attorney Paul E Bucher.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  The Court addresses the WCS non-compliance report and is inclined not to take any action as the defendant is currently in a treatment facility.  No objection by the State or Attorney Simon.  Hearing scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Letter from Nova advising the defendant was admitted for inpatient treatment on 6/2/2022.
Prelim waiver filed, Atty and Defendant may do zoom. Defendant at Nova Counseling in Oshkosh.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing. Filed by Atty Bucher.

Preliminary hearing on June 10, 2022 at 10:15 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level 2 supervision.  Court orders the defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM monitoring.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle at all.  Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court.  Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release.

01:08 PM Defendant Adam J Wachendorf in court, in custody, with attorney Paul E Bucher.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Court puts the defendant on notice if any letters are received due to WCS noncompliance, this court would be inclined to issue an immediate warrant for his arrest.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Attorney Paul Bucher
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
